Northwestern University Video Cassette Collection--Northwestern University Marching Band Highlights
Northwestern University (Evanston, Ill.). School of Music
Grainger, Percy, 1882-1961. British folk-music settings. Irish tune from County Derry, band
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof. Matchmaker
Bock, Jerry. Fiddler on the roof. Sunrise, sunset
University of Arkansas at Little Rock

Highlights from the Northwestern University Marching Band's 1941, 1961, 1966, 1972, 1981, and 1982 seasons. Highlights begin with silent footage from the 1941 and 1961 seasons. The highlights continue when the Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the October 22, 1966 Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Iowa Hawkeyes in Iowa City, Iowa. Conducted by John P. Paynter, the halftime performances include "William Tell Overture," "Irish Tune from County Derry," and "Bill Bailey Won't You Please Come Home." The next highlight is ABC Sports coverage of the Northwestern University Marching Band's performance at the October 28, 1972 Northwestern Wildcats' Homecoming game against the Indiana Hoosiers at Dyche Stadium in Evanston, Illinois. For the halftime performance, Northwestern alumni and lyricist Sheldon Harnick joins conductor John P. Paynter for a selection of songs from "Fiddler on the Roof" including "Matchmaker, Matchmaker" and "Sunrise Sunset." The NUMB alums join the band for a performance of "To Life." The Northwestern University Marching Band performs at the September 19, 1981 Northwestern Wildcats' game against the Arkansas Razorbacks in Little Rock, Arkansas. Halftime performance that includes include "Olympic Fanfare," "What the World Needs Now Is Love," "La Fiesta," and "I Write the Songs." The final highlight is a space-themed halftime performance from 1982 that includes "Space Invaders" and "Go U Northwestern." Following the marching band performances is footage of John P. Paynter conducting a rehearsal at the Northwestern University School of Music.

The recordings on this web site are provided for use by Northwestern University students, faculty, staff and guests. Further distribution and/or any commercial use of these recordings from this site is strictly prohibited. Please contact specialcollections@northwestern.edu for more information
Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections API
Homepage at Northwestern University Libraries Digital Collections

Digitization of this collection was funded by a generous gift from the family of Music professor and bandleader John Phillip Paynter, who began his musical studies at Northwestern, graduating with a Bachelor of Music degree in 1950 and a Master's in Theory and Composition in 1951. Upon graduation, Paynter joined NU's faculty as the Director of the Marching Band. During his career at Northwestern, Paynter taught classes in band music, conducting, and arranging.
